dart.code: /* * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amicable_numbers * *Amicable numbers are two different numbers related in such a way that the sum of the proper divisors of each is equal to the other number. * * */ //this function returns true if numbers are amicable and false otherwise bool amicable_number(int first_number, int second_number) { if (first_number <= 1 || second_number <= 1) return false; List<int> first_number_proper_divisors = []; List<int> second_number_proper_divisors = []; for (int i = 1; i < first_number; i++) { if (first_number % i == 0) first_number_proper_divisors.add(i); } for (int i = 1; i < second_number; i++) { if (second_number % i == 0) second_number_proper_divisors.add(i); } return first_number == second_number_proper_divisors.reduce((a, b) => a + b) && second_number == first_number_proper_divisors.reduce((a, b) => a + b); } void main() { print(amicable_number(12, 14)); // false print(amicable_number(220, 284)); // true print(amicable_number(60, 84)); // true print(amicable_number(1184, 1210)); //true print(amicable_number(-14, 10)); //false }
